value.title: Secure your cloud data in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: This learning path helps you leverage the built-in Azure services for securing app data, ensuring that only authorized services and clients have access.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

images.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
topItems.excerpt: Secure your web applications on Azure and protect your apps against the most common and dangerous web application attacks.

images.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production

topItems.title: Configure security policies to manage data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to set up policies to classify, retain, and protect your cloud-based data.

images.title: Configure security policies to manage data

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data. Find out how to use access keys, to secure networks, and to use Advanced Threat Protection to proactively monitor your system.

images.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

value.title: Secure your cloud data
value.excerpt: Azure was designed for security and compliance. Learn how to leverage the built-in services to store your app data securely to ensure that only authorized services and clients have access to it.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

images.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

topItems.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production
topItems.excerpt: Secure your web applications on Azure and protect your apps against the most common and dangerous web application attacks.

images.title: Top 5 security items to consider before pushing to production

topItems.title: Configure security policies to manage data
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to set up policies to classify, retain, and protect your cloud-based data.

images.title: Configure security policies to manage data

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data. Find out how to use access keys, to secure networks, and to use Advanced Threat Protection to proactively monitor your system.

images.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

value.title: Architect message brokering and serverless applications in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to create reliable messaging for your applications, and how to take advantage of serverless application services in Azure.

topItems.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions
topItems.excerpt: Azure Functions allow developers to host business logic that can be executed without managing or provisioning infrastructure.

images.title: Create serverless logic with Azure Functions

topItems.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps
topItems.excerpt: Define a workflow using built-in triggers, actions, and conditional operators. Your workflow will run automatically when data is available, process the data in the cloud, record results in a database, and send email notifications.

images.title: Route and process data automatically using Logic Apps

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
Create serverless logic with Azure Functions

topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

value.title: Architect a data platform in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect a data platform in Azure and build solutions to store relational and NoSQL data.

topItems.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure data storage options
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll explore the benefits of Azure data storage versus on-premises storage.

images.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure data storage options

topItems.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data
topItems.excerpt: Use the Azure Portal and Cloud Shell to provision, connect, and manage Azure SQL databases.

images.title: Provision an Azure SQL database to store application data

topItems.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools
topItems.excerpt: SQL elastic pools allow you to manage performance and cost for a collection of SQL databases.

images.title: Scale multiple Azure SQL Databases with SQL elastic pools

topItems.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
topItems.excerpt: Plan and implement the migration of relational data from SQL Server to Azure SQL Database. Select the appropriate migration strategy for your database, and then use Data Migration Assistant to do the assessment and the migration.

images.title: Migrate your relational data stored in SQL Server to Azure SQL Database
Core Cloud Services - Azure data storage options

value.excerpt: Learn how to architect a data platform in Azure and build solutions to store relational and NoSQL data.

value.title: Connect your services together learning path
value.excerpt: Use Azure to create website front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that compute-on-demand and can also communicate with each other.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus
topItems.excerpt: Write C# code in a custom application that sends and receives messages using Azure Service Bus topics and queues.

images.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Connect sending and receiving applications with Event Hubs so you can handle extremely high loads without losing data.

images.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

value.title: Connect your services together
value.excerpt: Azure lets you create applications composed of various components: web site front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that perform compute-on-demand services. Azure also includes various communication strategies to let these various components pass data to each other. Learn how to leverage these communication services to create scalable, efficient solutions out of testable components.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.excerpt: Write C# code in a custom application that sends and receives messages using Azure Service Bus topics and queues.

images.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Connect sending and receiving applications with Event Hubs so you can handle extremely high loads without losing data.

images.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

value.title: Building Open Source Software (OSS) Analytical Solutions with Azure HDInsight
value.excerpt: In this learning path, the learner will be introduced to HDInsight and how to apply this technology to solve a range of real world challenges.

topItems.title: Introduction to the Open source Analytics Offering
topItems.excerpt: At the end of this module, you will learn that Azure HDInsight is a fully managed cloud service that enables you to efficiently process massive amounts of data using the most popular open source frameworks.

images.title: Introduction to the Open source Analytics Offering

topItems.title: Choose the correct HDInsight Configuration to build open-source analytics solutions
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn the different configurations for ensuring optimal use of HDInsight from both a performance and cost perspective.

images.title: Choose the correct HDInsight Configuration to build open-source analytics solutions

topItems.title: Creating and configuring a HDInsight cluster
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to create a HDInsight Cluster, monitor a cluster and be aware of common provisioning issues.

images.title: Creating and configuring a HDInsight cluster

topItems.title: Perform advanced streaming data transformations with Apache Spark and Kafka in Azure HDInsight
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to create real-time streaming data analytics pipelines and applications on the cloud by using Azure HDInsight with Apache Kafka and Apache Spark.

images.title: Perform advanced streaming data transformations with Apache Spark and Kafka in Azure HDInsight
Introduction to the Open source Analytics Offering

topItems.title: Perform advanced streaming data transformations with Apache Spark and Kafka in Azure HDInsight
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to create real-time streaming data analytics pipelines and applications on the cloud by using Azure HDInsight with Apache Kafka and Apache Spark.

images.title: Perform advanced streaming data transformations with Apache Spark and Kafka in Azure HDInsight
Introduction to the Open source Analytics Offering

value.title: Data engineering with Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Learn how to harness the power of Apache Spark and powerful clusters running on the Azure Databricks platform to run large data engineering workloads in the cloud.

topItems.title: Describe Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Discover the capabilities of Azure Databricks and the Apache Spark notebook for processing huge files. Understand the Azure Databricks platform and identify the types of tasks well-suited for Apache Spark.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Spark architecture fundamentals
topItems.excerpt: Understand the architecture of an Azure Databricks Spark Cluster and Spark Jobs.

images.title: Spark architecture fundamentals

topItems.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Work with large amounts of data from multiple sources in different raw formats. Azure Databricks supports day-to-day data-handling functions, such as reads, writes, and queries.

images.title: Read and write data in Azure Databricks

topItems.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Your data processing in Azure Databricks is accomplished by defining DataFrames to read and process the Data. Learn how to perform data transformations in DataFrames and execute actions to display the transformed data.

images.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
Describe Azure Databricks

value.title: Perform data science with Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Learn how to harness the power of Apache Spark and powerful clusters running on the Azure Databricks platform to run data science workloads in the cloud.

topItems.title: Describe Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Discover the capabilities of Azure Databricks and the Apache Spark notebook for processing huge files. Understand the Azure Databricks platform and identify the types of tasks well-suited for Apache Spark.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks

topItems.excerpt: Understand the architecture of an Azure Databricks Spark Cluster and Spark Jobs.

topItems.excerpt: Work with large amounts of data from multiple sources in different raw formats. Azure Databricks supports day-to-day data-handling functions, such as reads, writes, and queries.

topItems.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
topItems.excerpt: Your data processing in Azure Databricks is accomplished by defining DataFrames to read and process the Data. Learn how to perform data transformations in DataFrames and execute actions to display the transformed data.

images.title: Work with DataFrames in Azure Databricks
Describe Azure Databricks

value.title: Import data into Azure Synapse Analytics by using PolyBase
value.excerpt: Load petabytes of data into an Azure Synapse Analytics database in minutes by using PolyBase.

images.title: Import data into Azure Synapse Analytics by using PolyBase

value.title: Implement a Data Warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Azure Synapse Analytics provides a relational big data store that can scale to Petabytes of data. In this learning path, you will learn how Azure Synapse Analytics can achieve this scale with its’ Massively Parallel Processing (MPP) architecture. Create a data warehouse in minutes and use familiar querying language to build reports. Load massive amounts of data in minutes, and ensure that your data warehouse is secure.

topItems.title: Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create a data warehouse in Azure Synapse Analytics in minutes to take advantage of massively parallel processing (MPP) and run complex queries at petabyte scale quickly.

images.title: Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.title: Query data in Azure Synapse Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to issue simple queries against Azure Synapse Analytics and how to visualize the data in both Excel and Power BI.

images.title: Query data in Azure Synapse Analytics

topItems.title: Import data into Azure Synapse Analytics by using PolyBase
topItems.excerpt: Load petabytes of data into an Azure Synapse Analytics database in minutes by using PolyBase.

images.title: Import data into Azure Synapse Analytics by using PolyBase
Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to create a data warehouse in Azure Synapse Analytics in minutes to take advantage of massively parallel processing (MPP) and run complex queries at petabyte scale quickly.

images.title: Design a data warehouse with Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
value.excerpt: Connect sending and receiving applications with Event Hubs so you can handle extremely high loads without losing data.

images.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs

value.title: Describe Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Discover the capabilities of Azure Databricks and the Apache Spark notebook for processing huge files. Understand the Azure Databricks platform and identify the types of tasks well-suited for Apache Spark.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks

value.title: Query data in Azure Synapse Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to issue simple queries against Azure Synapse Analytics and how to visualize the data in both Excel and Power BI.

images.title: Query data in Azure Synapse Analytics

value.title: Implement a Data Streaming Solution with Azure Streaming Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn the concepts of event processing and streaming data and how this applies to Azure Stream Analytics. You will then set up a stream analytics job to stream data, and learn how to manage and monitor a running job.

topItems.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Explore how Azure Stream Analytics integrates with your applications or Internet of Things (IoT) devices to gain insights with real-time streaming data. Learn how to consume and analyze data streams and derive actionable results.

images.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics

topItems.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results.

images.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics
Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics

value.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Explore how Azure Stream Analytics integrates with your applications or Internet of Things (IoT) devices to gain insights with real-time streaming data. Learn how to consume and analyze data streams and derive actionable results.

images.title: Work with data streams by using Azure Stream Analytics

value.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn how to create Azure Stream Analytics jobs to process input data, transform it with a query, and return results.

images.title: Transform data by using Azure Stream Analytics

value.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics
value.excerpt: Learn about Azure IoT Hub message routing, and Stream Analytics anomaly detection. Start by creating an app that simulates issues with conveyor belt vibration. Then, use the Azure portal to route all the data for archiving in blob storage. Finish by routing the vibration data to anomaly detection, using a built-in ML model.

images.title: Identify anomalies by routing data via IoT Hub to a built-in ML model in Azure Stream Analytics

value.title: Describe Azure Databricks Delta Lake architecture
value.excerpt: Use Delta Lakes as an optimization layer on top of blob storage to ensure reliability and low latency within unified Streaming + Batch data pipelines.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks Delta Lake architecture

value.title: Build and query a Delta Lake
value.excerpt: Learn how to use Delta Lake to create, append, and upsert data to Apache Spark tables, taking advantage of built-in reliability and optimizations.

images.title: Build and query a Delta Lake

value.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app
value.excerpt: This module covers continuous data export from IoT Central. You use the scenario from the "Create your first Azure IoT Central app" Learn module, where you control a refrigerated truck. This module adds continuous data export to both Blob storage, and an Event Hub. Then, a Power BI app is built to read and display the telemetry data on a mobile phone.

images.title: Set up continuous data export from Azure IoT Central to a Power BI app

value.title: Create production workloads on Azure Databricks with Azure Data Factory
value.excerpt: Azure Data Factory helps you create workflows that orchestrate data movement and transformation at scale. Integrate Azure Databricks into your production pipelines by calling notebooks and libraries.

images.title: Create production workloads on Azure Databricks with Azure Data Factory

value.title: Creating and configuring a HDInsight cluster
value.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to create a HDInsight Cluster, monitor a cluster and be aware of common provisioning issues.

images.title: Creating and configuring a HDInsight cluster

value.title: Deep learning with Horovod for distributed training
value.excerpt: Azure Databricks supports the Uber’s Horovod framework along with the Petastorm library to run distributed, deep learning training jobs on Spark using training datasets in the Apache Parquet format.

images.title: Deep learning with Horovod for distributed training

value.title: Describe Azure Databricks best practices
value.excerpt: Learn best practices for workspace administration, security, tools, integration, databricks runtime, HA/DR, and clusters in Azure Databricks.

images.title: Describe Azure Databricks best practices
